intro: Cupania racemosa, commonly known as the clustered cupania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges. Cupania racemosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along riverbanks.
